course_title: Freshman Seminar: Madness and the Tropics
class_notes: A seminar on the intersection of art, literature, psychiatry, and psychoanalysis in Brazil. We study the work of artists, writers, analysts, and psychiatrists (Machado de Assis, Nise de Silveira, Clarice Lispector, Lygia Clark, Bispo do Ros√°rio, Suely Rolnik, and more), with a focus on the intersection between language, consciousness, creativity, and bio politics. PREREQUISITES: None
course_description: Introduction to the study of Brazilian and Portuguese societies through different prisms (race and gender relations, national cinemas, sexuality, evolution of historical discourse, music, and more).
schedule_location: TTh 4pm-5:15pm in Math & Science Center - W307C
sections: Class Nbr: 1532, Section #: 1, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 4-5:15p, Instructor: S. Delgado Moya, Status: Open
